body: I have a concern here. Maven POM is set to pull in the hibernate-core dependency, which appears to be licensed under LGPL.  That is not something we can bundle.

I too would prefer that we do not document this feature. I am considering removing it. I am so sorry that effort was spent in documenting it.

The syntax for this statement is present in the parser. As present in code one could make a case that LOAD section is an appropriate place to document it. The feature grew out of a requirement that UPSERT  USING LOAD has no transactional protection in case of failure, while LOAD has protection against failure using snapshot mechanism. With this feature one can use the LOAD framework in code, to do UPSERT USING LOAD, and thereby use snapshot for protection against failure.

I would like to deprecate this syntax because
1) It is rather confusing. It is not clear what exactly it is, LOAD, UPSERT or UPSERT USING LOAD
2) UPSERT USING LOAD is typically used for performance reasons. With the overhead of using the utility LOAD framework and creating snapshots, the performance benefit is lost except for the largest upserts.

The recent commit doesn't address the issues I have raised. However, I am not giving -1 because I am assuming that some testing has been done with this strategy and It is better than the earlier one and solves some issue. Neither the jira [TRAFODION-2844] nor this PR explained what issue it solved. It just provided the solution

@selvaganesang  @sureshsubbiah 
Sorry I read your comments just now, thank you for your reviews and detailed comments :)
I've moved the example of `UPSERT USING LOAD` to `UPSERT Statement` and created a PR for it (Click [Here](https://github.com/apache/trafodion/pull/1411)).
I'll close this PR.
+1 Looks like this is ready to be merged.

I should mention one more fine point in the design. If one does "select [first n] * from t1 order by x", one expects to get the first N rows with respect to ordering on X. So the ordering requirement has to be satisfied by the child of the FirstN operator. In Explain, one will often see a "Sort" node below the "FirstN" in this case. On the other hand, if one does "select [any n] * from t1 order by x", the "Sort" is above the "FirstN" node; [any n] means we don't care which N rows; we just want those N rows sorted by X. Putting the "Sort" node above "FirstN" in this case is more efficient; we sort fewer rows.

@DaveBirdsall I build environment on a new server.
Because this cause a error when run first time, I can rerun this script instead, while I choose to modify the script.
Was there a JIRA for this?
Is there a JIRA associated with this change? (It is good to have one.)

Read paths are not yet affected. The affected write path are
1. Log error rows creation in the LOAD command
2. UNLOAD command that extracts the trafodion data to hdfs files.

I thought that it would be clear from the modified files, hence I didn't add it in the description.
@DaveBirdsall Thanks for your remiding, I've added the JIRA.
